argument.description: The first expression to evaluate whether it is the smallest.
Optional. Additional expressions that are to be evaluated.

returnType: The LEAST function returns a value that is the same datatype as expr1. Having a NULL value in one of the expressions will return NULL as the least value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL LEAST function returns the smallest value in a list of expressions.
sample:
LEAST(2, 5, 12, 3)
Result: 2

LEAST('2', '5', '12', '3')
Result: '12'

LEAST('apples', 'oranges', 'bananas')
Result: 'apples'

LEAST('apples', 'applis', 'applas')
Result: 'applas'

LEAST('apples', 'applis', 'applas', null)
Result: NULL
